title: Terrence K. Abshers New Book Koot: A Novel is a Historic and Enlightening Work About the First People of Nevada
text:
Recent release “Koot: A Novel” from Page Publishing author Terrence K. Absher is a collection of stories about the past that aim to inform the reader about the first people to inhabit the land of Nevada.
(PRWEB) October 20, 2015
Terrence K. Absher, a retired teacher, family-man, devoted writer and author, has completed his new book “Koot: A Novel”: a gripping and potent tale that delves into the ideas of ancestry, history and values.
Published by New York City-based Page Publishing, Terrence K. Absher’s poignant tale is a historic account of the original people of Nevada.
“In the area of Wadsworth Nevada, the first people used skins of rabbits and duck feathers for articles of clothing. They moved with the seasons to gather food. The greatest family pride I was permitted to view was a baby's blanket made from feathers of a black mud buck. I changed the spelling to "Koot." The leading male character in my book was wrapped in a Koot blanket when he was delivered to the uncles. Now you know how the story starts,” said author Terrence K. Absher.
Readers who wish to experience this significant work can purchase “Koot: A Novel” at bookstores everywhere, or online at the Apple iTunes store, Amazon, Google Play or Barnes and Noble.
For additional information or media inquiries, contact Page Publishing at 866-315-2708.
